thread.title: Governor promises to veto health oversight bill
thread.title_full: Governor promises to veto health oversight bill

title: Governor promises to veto health oversight bill
text:
Governor promises to veto health oversight bill Bill would give panel oversight of state health insurance decisions Published On: Oct 15 2015 06:39:05 AM CDT Updated On: Oct 15 2015 08:58:57 PM CDT Tweet MADISON, Wis. - 
Gov. Scott Walker is promising to veto a bill that would give the Legislature's powerful budget-writing committee oversight of the state's expansive health insurance program. Related Content Dean of 3 UW campuses prepares for job cuts, changes around campus 
The Joint Finance Committee approved the bill unanimously on Thursday. The bill's supporters say they want to be able to approve or block decisions by the board that oversees the program as it contemplates moving to a self-insurance model. 
Walker vetoed similar provisions in the state budget that would have given the Legislature's employment committee oversight of the program. His spokeswoman said Thursday evening he plans to veto this bill, too, if it reaches his desk because it could create unnecessary delays. 
Copyright 2015 The Associated Press.
